snippet: Across the country, states and districts are increasingly funneling public funds to religious schools, private nursery schools and a variety of nonprofit organizations that conduct classes.
abstract: States and districts across the country are increasingly funneling public funds to religious schools, private nursery schools and a variety of nonprofit organizations that conduct preschool classes; as Pres Obama pushes proposal to provide public preschool for all 4-year-olds from families with low or moderate incomes, administration acknowledges many children will attend classes outside public school system.
lead_paragraph: Across the country, states and districts are increasingly funneling public funds to religious schools, private nursery schools and a variety of nonprofit organizations that conduct classes.

headline.main: Private Preschools See More Public Funds as Classes Grow
headline.print_headline: Private Preschools See More Public Funds as Classes Grow
